site_name: Pavement Opposite Banquet Records52 Eden StreetKingston Upon ThamesKT1 1EE
description: Removal of BT kiosk(s) and replacement with 1no. new InLink structure
decision_conditions: The proposed development by virtue of its size and siting would result in a visually intrusive incongruous addition to the streetscene that would compete with existing street furniture and signage creating street clutter and detract from the character and appearance of the area. The proposal would not accord with policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation. These cover such works as - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works. Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts. A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.
Please provide photographs of the trees.This is required due to the current situation.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Very minor works to maintain small trees to rear not affecting public amenity.Recommendation:No objections.
